intro: Amoora caesifolia, commonly known as the white-flowered champa, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. Amoora caesifolia thrives in humid climates and is adaptable to various soil types.
